snippet: It has been a good week for Senator Scott P. Brown, who has managed to keep his challenger, Elizabeth Warren, on the ropes.
abstract: Political Memo; Massachusetts Republican Sen Scott P Brown seizes momentum in his re-election campaign; main challenger Democrat Elizabeth Warren has been engulfed in controversy stemming from accusations by the Brown camp that she sought an unfair advantage in her academic career by claiming American Indian ancestry; analysts are divided about the importance of the ancestry issue and whether it represents a turning point in a race in which the polls have shown the candidates running neck and neck. Photo (M)

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE

lead_paragraph: BOSTON -- The half-court basketball shot that Senator Scott P. Brown sank on Friday during a visit to a youth center -- recorded by his staff and widely circulated on the Web -- was just the beginning. So far this week, Mr. Brown, a Republican, has won endorsements by Democratic former mayors of Boston and Worcester, given a speech emphasizing his votes across party lines and released a radio ad calling on Americans to ''work together now'' despite partisan differences.

headline.main: Shot Sunk, And Taken, In Campaign
